venue.name: The Nature Conservancy's Lubberland Creek Preserve

item.description:
The Sweet Trail is a four mile (8 mile round trip) pedestrian trail located in the Crommet Creek Conservation Area, stretching from Longmarsh Road in Durham to the Great Bay Estuary in Newmarket. The Sweet Trail travels through lands protected, owned and managed by the town of Durham, The Nature Conservancy, New Hampshire Fish and Game, the Society for the Protection of NH Forests, and private landowners. The lands were protected by the Great Bay Partnership. Please see complete description and uses of the trail in theSweet Trail Guide (PDF download).

 

Let's take this 8 mile journey through the beautiful seacoast area of Great Bay. Bring a lunch, plenty of water, and dress appropriately for spring temperatures and current weather conditions.

 

DIRECTIONS From downtown Durham, take route 108 south for approximately 1.5 miles.

Turn left onto Longmarsh Road towards the Town of Durham’s Longmarsh Preserve.

The trailhead is located 2 miles down the road with parking on the left side just before the gate.

Parking for the “easy” portion of the trail is located approximately 2 miles down Dame Road (off route 108 in Durham) on the right at the NH Fish & Game’s Great Bay Wildlife Management Area: Crommet Creek.

Parking at the end of the trail is located at The Nature Conservancy’s Lubberland Creek Preserve in Newmarket.

From Durham, travel route 108 south for 3.7 miles and turn left onto Bay Road. The parking lot is located 1.6 miles on the left, just past the Conservancy’s Great Bay Office.
item.how_to_find_us: Your hosts are; Bill Riley who knows the area well, and Doug C who's also familiar with the area, and knows all of you.

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Easy Hike along "The Sweet Trail" in a Great Bay Conservation Area
